Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Reviewer: Jon L Jacobi and Melissa Riofrio
Item.Review:
Athough the HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One multifunction inkjet printer looks strikingly similar to the company's HP Photosmart eStation, you cannot, as you can with the eStation, remove the LCD control panel and use it like a tablet. Believe us, it's the first thing we tried. But the Photosmart 7510 is a well-rounded unit, with good speed and print quality, and sufficient features to address both home and home-office needs.
The HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One is easy to set up, and the software is first-rate. A printed setup booklet is in the box, but you'll have to go online to find the full user guide in PDF format. HP's instructions were unclear as to whether you could print, download, or read the guide; we downloaded the file without a problem and notified HP about the confusi ... ng directions. The 4.3-inch colour touchscreen LCD panel has a clear, icon-based menu structure. The printer is also fully endowed with cloud-printing capabilities, specifically HP's own Web-based apps, and HP ePrint and Apple AirPrint for printing from mobile devices.
See also: Group test: what's the best printer?
While the HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One is aimed at users who print lots of photos, its paper-handling features are more than adequate for a small or home office as well. The main paper tray holds 125 sheets, while a second tray integrated into the top of the main tray holds 20 sheets of photo paper up to 5-by-7-inch size. The real bonus is the 25-sheet automatic document feeder (ADF)--still too rare among home-oriented units. This feeder makes up for the fact that the lid for the A4 flatbed scanner doesn't telescope to accommodate thicker materials. The Photosmart 7510 can print and scan in duplex (both sides of the page).
For an inkjet printer, the HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One was fast in most of our tests. On letter-size plain paper (Hammermill Laserprint) at default settings, text pages emerged at a speedy rate of 9.6 pages per minute (ppm) on the PC and 9 ppm on the Mac; a 4-by-6-inch photo took 15 seconds (or 4 ppm). Switching to HP Advanced Photo Paper and finer-quality settings, the same photo took 33 seconds (1.8 ppm), and a full-page, high-resolution photo print on the Mac took about 2.5 minutes (a middling rate of 0.4 ppm). Scanning and copying speeds are a tad faster than average compared with other inkjet MFPs we've tested.
Output from the HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One is generally very good - with HP's penchant for cooler colour temperatures. Text is sharp and dark at default settings, and monochrome graphics are rich, though slightly green. Photos printed on plain paper look nice, other than orange-ish flesh tones; on HP's Advanced Photo Paper, the quality is smooth and realistic, though in a somewhat solemn colour palette, with darker areas gradating to black somewhat quickly.
The HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One's ink costs are reasonable. The three standard colour cartridges (cyan, magenta, and yellow) cost £8.99 each and last for 300 pages (2.9p per page), while the standard black costs £8.95 and lasts for 250 pages, or 3.5ppp. That's just over 12p for a four-colour page. You can reduce colour ink costs significantly with the XL cartridges, which are £16.99 for 750 pages, or 2.2ppp. The XL black represents less of a savings at £18.99 for 550 pages or 3.5ppp.
See also: Group test: what's the best inkjet printer? expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: Good WLAN printer & scanner with some limitations
Item.Review:
+: +Easy setup.
+Good WLAN setup and stabile connection.
+Nice and high quality pictures if you print in highest quality mode.
+Scans fast.
+Auto doc feeding works well and is unique for this price class of devices.
+Big touchscreen is a nice feature (but sometimes a ´bit slow).
+Prints wireless from my Lenovo Ideapad A1 (Android).
+Prints from my SDHC card of my DSLR camera, -preview and easy to select printing targets. Print photos without using a PC, that´s cool.
-: -Uses too much ink. Even if the cartridges have a barely acceptable price, the cleaning etc. exhausts the colors to fast. They are simply to small in capacity. The xl-ones are too expensive and not really a money saver. So order some ink cartidge spares in advance ... .
-Thick photo paper (>260/280 gr.) not detected and accepted for photo printing. Because it cannot be put in another feed tray you can forget about to use it....
-Much louder in printing than my old Canon IP5000.
-Standard/default quality mode settings of photos delivers poor quality, needs to be put in highest mode setting. Then it´s ok, but slow (as usual).
-Scan of very thick books not possible.
Remarks: Some people should not rate the printer because of their unability to put them into their home network. The printer is not the culprit, if the router/firewall blocks the device, provides no IP address or is misconfigured.
HP should mark the efax item to be a matter of additional costs, if exceeding 20 incoming faxes and 20 outgoing faxes a month. I never used it, but people should be aware of it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Great print quality, Great functionality, Tons of features
Cons: Set-up time, size, Touch screen
It's amazing what consumer printers can do these days. Buying a printer has now become buying a fax machine, a scanner, a copier, and even a web browser all in one large machine. The HP Photosmart 7510 has a ton of fantastic features that are sure to please the masses, whether you're using it for your business or simply for home use. You can use it to print off great looking photos on photo paper, all of your documents, or even to print things from the web right from the printer itself! Not only that, but you can use it as a copier or a scanner as well. It's simply a joy to use, once you're able to get it all set up, which can be a real pain. In my review, I'll discuss the p ... ros and cons that I saw while using the printer, and you can decide whether or not it will fit your personal needs. Hopefully I can help you make that decision!
Pros:
- Print quality: The quality of all the prints from the Photosmart 7510 were absolutely fantastic. Documents all turned out quite stunningly and clear, and even pictures printed on the included photo paper turned out colorful and professional looking. I have no complaints with the performance of the printer in these aspects. - Connectivity: One of the coolest things about the Photosmart 7510 is that you can hook it up to the internet and print many sorts of documents and pictures right from the printer's touchscreen interface. You can log into Facebook and print your pictures from your albums right from the printer itself, which is pretty easy to set up and is surprisingly efficient. Pictures printed from the printer's own internet connectivity were really excellent, and it's a great and useful feature. - Wireless: I can't express enough of how much of a pain it is to mess with wires and what not when trying to print pictures and documents, or even to scan. The Photosmart 7510 connects to your home wifi network (with some pretty annoying setup) and allows you to print and scan wirelessly from multiple devices. It's a breeze to use ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

The photo print quality is excellent. Printing documents is fast and high quality. Scanning and faxing is a breeze! The touchpad and links to internet are really cool. The design is functional and aesthetically pleasing. But BEST OF ALL -- IT IS SUPER EASY TO SET UP!!!! OUT OF THE BOX AND WORKING IN UNDER 10 MINUTES!!!!!! We have been so impressed and satisfied with this printer! 5 stars for features, performance, ease of use, tech support - ********* Excellent product.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: Top Quality, Seamless integration with Ipad2
Item.Review:
Pros: Great features, easy to use, simple setup instructions, high quality prints.
Cons: Comes with Ink cartridges which are not "full" - must buy initial replacements right away.
After struggling with another major brand of printer, I chose to go back to HP - what a great decision. Right out of the box, this printer rocks! Unbox it, remove all the tape and packing materials, plug it in and simply follow the clear instructions on the high quality color touch screen display. The only gripe (and it's a minor one) is that the ink cartridges that come with the unit are not "FULL" - that is, they are good for only about 20 sheets or less. It's a good thing the salesmen told us, so we would understand. But really, this seems like a cheap way out. Other than that, it sync'd right up ... with all three computers in the house and my iPad2 with absolutely ZERO issues. 4x6 color prints are spectacular. Highly recommend! Great value when on sale. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: eprint, separate color cartridges, added photo cartridge, integrated photo paper and printing paper compartment
Cons: Wireless connectively and MacBook Air functionality
FANTASTIC printer for Windows users, however for Apple MacBook users there are some challenges....installation of the software, printer recognition, and disconnecting from the MacBook every time the printer enters sleep mode. There is NO way to deactivate the sleep mode.
Besides the annoying issues for Mac, the print quality is fantastic, photo print quality is superior. The large touch screen is intuitive and easy to navigate. The addition of printer apps gives unique printer functionality and specialized print functions (calendars, checklists, weather reports, etc.)
The e-print function ... has been a fun application that allows me to print from my smartphone, which is great when you want to print coupons, e-mails, pictures immediately, without spinning up the computer.
The quality and functionality for the price, can't be beat. Recommend improving software for Mac users to make this 5-stars across the board. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Solid construction, high-quality printing, wireless all-the-time access
The first thing that struck me when removing the Photosmart 7510 from the box was the printer’s quality construction. Fit and finish of the printer are above average, and it feels more solid than other printers – even those within HP’s retail line.
Setup was straightforward. There’s a one-page easy setup guide that shows you how to unpack and turn on the printer. The rest of the initial setup is guided by a small display on the front of the printer. The display works the same way your smart phone does: with a touch screen interface and gestures that allow you to navigate through the various menus. The touch screen is responsive, and navigating menus is fairly snappy.
The HP Photosmart 7510 ac ... cepts five colored ink cartridges – magenta, cyan, yellow and black, plus a dark grey cartridge to help with the mid-tones in your photos. The black cartridge is larger than the other cartridges to support the kind of day-to-day black and white printing you’ll be doing most often. Once you load the ink cartridges, the printer goes through an initialization that takes a couple minutes.
I have a MacBook Pro 17” with the latest version of Lion installed. With this version of OS X (the Mac operating system), HP recommends you skip the installation disk and download your software directly from Apple. Because of this, I connected to the wireless network using the smart phone display on the front of the printer. I then opened MS Word on my Mac, accessed the print menu, selected the 7510 and was prompted to install the HP software. The software downloaded automatically, and I was able to print wirelessly without any problems.
Print quality for a standard Word document was as good as the HP printer I use at work, which weighs about five times as much as this machine. I then printed a few pictures from Aperture, a photo management application. The quality of these pictures (shot with a Canon EOS 7D) was exceptional, with accurate flesh tones and a good range of tone and colors. At thi ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: The HP Photosmart 7510e-all-in-one was probably more than I needed, but I'm very glad I bought it. The set up was VERY easy, with NO glitches. The prints are crisp, clear. I had never printed a photo before, but the quality from this printer is amazing. I like having an automatic document feeder AND a flatbed for the scanner. I like having separate cartridges for the various colors and black... I purchased the High-Speed USB cable as a precaution, but I did not need it. I received a $50 instant rebate which made this a very affordable printer--well worth the price.

Cons: Large Footprint
Everything you'll ever need and more! It produces great quality copies and photos. Didn't know how much I would use the auto-feed tray on top but I do almost all the time. Touch screen is super easy to use and a nice size. Holds a fair amount of paper and you can keep your 4x6 photo paper in its own tray so its ready to use all the time. Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
In searching for a new printer, I found the HP Photosmart 7510 All-in-One to be well suited to my needs. Ordering from the HP Online Store was a breeze, the item was shipped quickly, and in less than a week my new printer had arrived.
Installation of the new 7510 was also quite easy. The wireless configuration presented no problems at all, and only took a couple of minutes. Software setup and ink cartridge was also without issue, with the provided diretions being spot on with respect to the process. The on screen graphics displaying the proper installation steps was quite good, and a nice touch.
Printer output, whether printing documents or images is exemplary, and the photo printing is nearly as good as what I get from the local photo processing shop. Better than the imaging ... we got in years past from the Photo Hut (remember those?).
Scans are quite good, being clear and crisp, with small type fonts displaying clearly and easily readable. No smudging or "jaggies" apparent in the printed output. The Copy feature, with the paper loading tray is easy to use, and provides quick output of the copied material, whether in black or white or in full color.
I'm not overly impressed with the eFax capability. Not with the printer itself, but with a service that requires a certain number of faxes per month to avoid charges. I don't fax often enough to meet the standard, so I'll probably never use this feature. I was mildly disappointed, as I had hoped I might be able to fax from home, when the need does arise, instead of driving down to the local UPS store to use their fax service.
All in all, I'd have to say this printer has all the capabilities I was looking for, and is a unit I could safely recommend to my friends and family. It's small foot print and multiple functionality are a boon to my small office space, and the price for this unit has made it a great addition. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: Everything I wanted in this all in one
Item.Review: I received the new 7510 this week after shopping around to replace my 3-year old HP All in one. The 7510 has all the features that I wanted - auto document feed, eFax, network connectivity, and included software. All of those features are excellent, especially the eFax, which includes 20 faxes per month each sending and receiving. Perfect for someone who needs to fax occasionally. The unit also looks great. Upon receiving the unit, I immediately noticed the lack of owners manual and installation CD. I'm not sure if those were omitted from my packaging by accident or if it's a cost-savings measure. Not a big deal, either way. Otherwise the presentation was very impressive, with the printer arriving in a mesh bag and the power cord in a fabric pouch, both which are reusable. Unpacking was ... a breeze and setup was much easier than the last HP all-in-one I got 3 years ago. I had to download the drivers and software from the web, which is not a big deal because at least I'm sure to be using the most recent version. Installation on my two PCs -- a hard-wired desktop and wifi laptop -- was easy. HP even gives you the option to not have certain services run in the background for those interested in keeping their PC's performance top notch. Very impressive. One thing I thought was odd, was when attaching my desktop via USB cable, I got a warning stating that significant amounts of functionality would be lost if not connecting via network. Interestingly, I did not notice any difference in connecting the desktop via USB and laptop via wifi. As far as performance goes, I would say that this product meets expectations but is in no way breaking new ground. It is very loud while printing, and shakes my desk. The text and graphics print quality using normal mode is just okay. In fact, I'd venture to say my old c4385 model had better quality printing. That being said, the 7510 does all it is designed to do. There are a ton of add-on apps and useful software for use with the printer. T ... expand » « collapse

Being able to duplex print without having to pull the paper out and turning it over is very nice this priniter actually duplex prints. The Fax is via efax and gives you your own fax number and up to 20 faxes a month for free. Copying is very easy as well. The auto document feeder wells very well. Overall it is already my favorite printer and I have been buying printers since 1990.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything

My 5510 HP seemed to have had way more apps available for viewing. But It stopped working on me it seemed cheaply made and flimsy too with frequent paper jams. I thought if I paid more money and upgraded to the 7510 I'd get more app options at least, Wrong! However the 7510 does seem to be a bit harder,sturdier and has a bit more durability than the 5510. Im just so shocked that HP would make a product so weak and flimsy, if you poke it (5510) it bends. I knew that 5510 wouldn't hold up too long. The bottom of it was so soft where the paper tray is located , the paper basically touches the surface you place the printer on. Everything about the 5510 was soft and weak. I'm sorry but hard is better t ... han a softy. The 7510 print quality is fast and has nice colors. It takes 564 ink. Great ink reasonable price. The feeder is awesome. I'm loving the e-fax. Its like having a real fax machine with out having to scan each page. All you have to do is place pages in the feeder then type in the recipents fax number, then WhaLa you get a receipt for your sent fax. The only bad thing about e-fax is they are very pricy for those of you who don't fax that often. Anyway, the wifi connection is great. Setup was a breeze. It seems like I have to press on the screen a bit hard. I don't like that at all.The HP c309g screen is better. Thanks HP stay HARD and DURABLE and please make MORE APPS available for us. expand » « collapse

Item.Review:
This printer does a lot of great things. I have only had it for 2 weeks so I will know more soon.
I had someone who knows how to setup printers and it took about an hour setting up because of the electronic print and fax.
I am a quadriplegic so I Can't use the front panel. I can't print with my phone or computer, but I don't know if I can use the apps from them.
It does a great job with pictures. I am very happy with it at this point. I will review it again once I get to know it better.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Photo quality is far and away superior to Brother or Cannon printers in the same price range. Thanks for ease of use and installation too. HP, WTG!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable construction; Reliable; Compact Design; Fast Print Time; Easy To Use; Low Ink Consumption; Easy To Set Up
Cons: Touchpad is worthless; Loud; Not a legal size glass; No duplex scanning
This is the only printer by HP that is dedicated to photographs. Best feature overall. Excellent quality prints. I'm really disappointed that the glass is only letter size; however, you can scan a legal size document. I scan all hardcopies of receipts for business purposes and many receipts are longer than letter size. Frustrating. I called HP comparing printers before buying and mentioned this issue. The rep told me I could cut the receipt in half. I didn't like that answer as I don't like wasting time to do so. But I can live with it. The touchpad is absolutely worthles ... s to me. There is nothing on there that impressed me, so don't count on that as a great feature. Overall, I'm extremely happy with the photo print quality. It could use a few tweaks, but for [$] it was an excellent buy. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Unbelievable! I love this printer. I was able to set it up wirelessly for 3 taptops, my husband's IPad and his cell phone so quickly it amazed me. I had a Dell for 3 years and could never figure out how to connect it wireless let alone to so many products. And the photo quality speaks for itself. Your pictures really come to life and the options availabe will blow you away. If you buy it enjoy because I know we sure are.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:

I got this printer to replaced my Kodak I had which has serious issues. I love it. Easy setup and fast printing. Only thing that I didn't like was that the cartridge does not last long. It cost about 2.50 more than Kodak's. Suppose to get 1000 prints but mine did not and machine does not give a warning it is almost out. Quality of printing is excellent Very nice machine.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: A good printer to service a household
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast, Easy Setup, Low Power Usage
Cons: Photo print quality, kind of loud, flatbed scanner is blocked by the touchscreen
I've never been a big fan of HP printers. The software has been an especially been painful experience. When I received the 7510 for review, you could probably imagine that I wasn't excited.
Setup was fairly easy, though fairly slow. I opted to set up the printer directly from the touch panel because the wireless HP printers that I'd setup in the past required a USB connection. The HP software was required if you wanted to print from a PC but it's connection over wireless never became an issue. Connection problems did occur when I tested some firewall software with it; you'll more than likely have to add an exception to the firewall.
Spea ... king of print options, I had absolutely no issues with any of the print options available. The novelty of emailing a print job to the 7510 was short-lived but printing from my Android tablet or iPad or Google Documents was easy and kind of fun. I encountered only two jams in my time testing this printer: once because I didn't allow for enough clearance in the print tray and once during testing of the duplex printing function.
Scanning was also a fairly easy but it required a little bit of setup; the software was necessary if you were going to scan to a PC of course, but it did have a couple of crashes. When attempting to scan to a full resolution png, the scanner actually crashed and required me to shutdown and restart the printer, claiming that my PC needed required memory. The simplex page feeder on the scanner worked well enough, though I did encounter a couple of jams, especially on paper that had previously been stapled together. Scanning large books was nearly impossible due to poor planning of the placement of the touch screen. The screen folds toward you to allow for a little more clearance but it was generally in the way. It would have been nicer if I could have slid the screen down instead. Scanning to an SD card was fine and at the higher levels, the detail was impressive, although the results were a bit on the dark sid ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Feature filled printer but watch out for fax
Item.Review:
Pros: Air print for iPhones and iPads, Great quality, lots of features
Cons: Fax does not hook up to phone line - Need eFax account, Screen can be finicky
There are many great things about this all in one printer, and a few things to watch out for.
POSITIVES: ● Air Print - You can print directly from your iPhone or iPad with no additional apps to download on your devices. Works great! ● Great Print quality - Documents, and photos all look great! Colors are vivid, black is very black (hard to achieve for most printers) ● Relatively fast - It's no speed demon, by any means, but it is faster than most. ● Separate tray for 4x6 photo paper - If you print a lot of photos, that's a nice touch. ● Nice big screen - Touch screen makes things pretty easy with no ne ... ed for PC. ● Great scanning - Quality is pretty good. Option to use glass or automatic feeder is great! ● Double sided printing - Need I say more? ● Wireless printing - No need to plug PC into it. If you have wireless in your home or office, it will work great. ● Easy to setup - It does almost everything and guides you when you first plug it in.
NEGATIVE: ● FAX - THIS IS NOT A FAX YOU CAN USE WITH YOUR PHONE LINE!!! It allows you to use eFax. Personally, I love eFax, but the problem is that it does require a monthly fee, so be aware. If you fax a lot, you should use eFax anyways. A lot more convenient and cheaper than printing your faxes. ● Display is finicky - The brightness on mine goes in and out. I have a feeling I probably got a bad one, but something to watch out for. Personally, I never use the screen, so I don't care. ● Ink cost is medium of the road - It's not the most expensive printer by any means, but not the cheapest. For example, on this printer, your cost for 8 1/2 x11 paper, per page will be: - Black & White - 4.8 cents - Color - 14.8 cents per page. If you print photos, that cost goes way up to 22.5 cents per 5% of coverage. So if only 5% of an 8x10 photo is covered by ink, it will cost you 22.5 cents. Obviously, that never happens. Most pictures you print will be around 80%, which is 16 times more, so an 8x10 will cost you $3.60 in toner. If you tak ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Wireless
Cons: Large Footprint
I've set up quite a few small inkjets, and this was by far the easiest ever. It takes up a little more space, but I like the individual ink cartridges and the wireless ease. The few photos we've printed in the couple weeks we have had this printer came out very nice. I perhaps expected them to smudge less easily, but what do you want from a low cost inkjet, right?

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: East setup and printing or copying and scanning!!!
Cons: False statement for this product!!!
The best printer I have ever bought. I bought it at $70.00 below price at Best Buy. It is better than I expected, the best buy out there for a home printer. Easy to setup and easy to use. MY wife and I have android phones and can print from them. My wife is not very good with HI tech stuff. or low tech for that matter. She can even handle printing out photos with this printer, and enjoys doing so!!!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: wireless printing, efaxing, smartphone printing
Cons: scanner prints with a 3 inch black line thru the page.
This is a review of the HP Photosmart 7510 all-in-one printer. First, let me say that I love this printer. It's unbelievable all the things this printer can do. I'm coming from an all in three Canon printer. (Printer, Copier, Scanner.)
The HP 7510 has everything that a home office needs. From wifi/network printing, to printing from a tablet or smartphone. It even comes with a 25 page feeder for fast coping, scanning or faxing. Speaking of faxing, you can fax/receive up to 20 pages a month for free, by using the efax service. The cool thing about this is, you don't need a phone line. Which means you can set up this printer anywhere you want. Since you don't ... need a phone line to fax, you don't have to pay to have an extra line installed to use this feature.
The photo print quality is excellent and just as good as when you have your photo's printed at the photoshop. (You can even print pictures from your smartphone, tablet, laptop, etc.) It even has a separate tray for the photo paper that holds up to 20 sheets from wallet size up to an 8X10.
If you have kids, they will love being able to print coloring pages, arts and crafts projects using the onboard apps. You can customize the type of apps you have on your home screen and it is really easy to edit them. The apps store has a lot of useful apps to choose from and you should find something for everyone in your home.
Me and my wife have android smartphones and downloaded the HP ePrint Home & Biz app, from the android market. This allows you to send things to print from our phones to the printer. (This is so cool). You can even change the paper source, size, crop the picture, if you want your document in color or just gray scale, black and white. My wife loves being able to print from her netbook, while setting in her recliner or in bed. You can even send things to print from outside the home. Since it has it's own unique and secure email address, you just forward a document, email, etc. to the printers email address ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use and setup
Printer is easy to setup wish it had option to hook a hard phone line for faxing. The photo quality is very good. Double sided printing is easy however you have to reset the option to automatically do double sided printing everytime I turn on my computer. Overall it is a very good printer and is easy to use. It is easy to use with smart phones too as my phone easily recognized it.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast Print Time; Durable construction; Reliable; Compact Design
Cons: Additional cost for fax
Difficult setting up. Could not get wireless to work and used cable. Later, found out that the router must be 1.6 m from unit. After moving router, wireless worked for printing but not scanning. Uninstalled software and reinstalled and it worked. Found out that for faxing you need to sign-up for some efax service at $14+ per month. Not worth it for one or two fax per month. Bought a fax modem for $12.55 and now I can fax on phone line for $0. Basically,I like the quality of printing and photos, but screen is too complicated.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use
Cons: Hard Setup; Too much ink used
1)Every time it prints it sounds like gears are being chewed up!
2) The INK STATUS application is not accurate. It usually shows some ink left in a cartridge AFTER the cartridge has already run dry.
3) Sucks ink faster than I think is appropriate for the cost of the cartridges
4)Why isn't HP asking for my comments?

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: Eco-friendly packaging, easy-as-pie setup, and solid WiFi performance. Was up and running with WiFi, ePrint, apps, and drivers in less than 15 minutes. Screen requires a bit of pressure to register touches to it, and is about the only fault I found with it. Picture quality is excellent (almost as good as Costco's photo lab), and the app selection is outstanding. Speaking of apps--printing from the Picasa app isn't as intuitive as it could be, and the output is, well, less than acceptable. Suggest using the Picasa App on your PC/Mac instead.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use; Fast Print Time
This printer provides all of the features that I was looking for in a new printer/scanner. The network print/scan features all were very easy to set up. It only took minutes to be printing from my PC, netbook, work laptop (download drivers) and tablet (download app), all wirelessly without any problems. The TWAIN drivers on my PC and netbook worked seemlessly with existing software applications, without any fuss. This printer also uses HP's 5-cartridge ink system and the photo print quality is very good--much better than my old Epson Color Stylus.
The only setup trouble, requiring a call to HP technical support, was setting up the ePrint and eFax services. I tried all of the self-help solutions without success. The TSR who as ... sisted me understood everything that I'd tried, and was able to go immediately to a solution that worked quickly. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Low profile, nice touch panel
Cons: Fax capability is very poor, user interface is not as good as other manufacturers.
I have been a HP printer owner for many years. This one was replacing an HP OfficeJet K80xi fax printer that I bought in 2000. I really needed a fax capability combined with wireless. After looking at several printers, the salesperson steered me to this one because of the integration with eFax. What I did not know what that eFax is the ONLY way to fax and that if you want to send over 20 pages a month, you have to sign up for a $13.99/month subscription. Also, you cannot fax directly from Microsoft word or any other programs initiated from your PC/Mac. Wireless printing is "OK" but I have have a much better user interface with a Canon Pixma printer that ... I bought for the family printer. The Canon blows through ink very fast. I don't have comparable data for this HP yet. The printer sometimes takes a few minutes to initialize and other times responds rather fast. Setup is not as smooth as the Canon but passable. Print quality is fine, no issues. I wish it had an external jack for the phone line. I don't think it's worth the money for the features you get. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up
This is a great all around use printer. Much better on ink usage than my last printer. Good quality pictures. Easy quick setup even for wireless. I would buy it again.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Reliable; Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use; Fast Print Time
Cons: Large Footprint
I love this printer! The Eprint functions are fantastic and the photo print quality is amazing. It is very convenient because it has separate paper trays for regular paper and photo paper. It is great to email a document or photo to the printer from any location and have it printed out when I get home.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: I bought the printer yesterday and was easily able to set it up to wirelessly print with my MacBook Pro (Snow Leopard), two iPhones, and a PC running XP. The instruction book is only a couple of pages with the first page being the 'getting started" instructions and the rest the "in case something isn't working properly or would you like to use the added features" instructions. The set up on the printer touchpad was easy to use, offered friendly Show Me illustrations and the touchscreen was very responsive. Printer speed was normal, and print quality was fine. I was impressed by how fast the photo prints were printed and the quality they yielded, I may never send my photos to a store ever again. If you're not a huge photo enthusiast, but still appreciate a good print job for your pictures t ... hat rivals Walgreens, CVS and Target then this is for you. My only quips with this was that the set-up assistance did not take me through the wireless set up, efax, or eprint. I had to find them in the instructions or locate them on the touchpad and go from there, but overall these were still very easy to set up. Also, my efax account did not give me the option to print 20 free pages, only the option to purchase two types of monthly services with the lowest starting at $17/mo...I hardly ever fax, and that is why the free 20 pages a month service really appealed to me, but it doesn't work for me... Hope it doesn't use too much ink, but even so the cartridges really aren't as bad as most HP cartridges are. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Difficult to use; Photo quality not good
Cons: Too much ink used; Hard To Use
I had an H/P 3200 series all in one. Lasted 6 years. this one can't compare to it. Photo quality is not crisp. Colors dull. that is the main reason i purchased it for photos.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Fast Print Time; Easy To Set Up
This printer was very easy to set up - I had it out of the box and up and running in 15 minutes. Photo and document print quality is exceptional for the price.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: It is easy to use.
Cons: It seems to suck up the ink quickly.
It was very easy to set up and it is very easy to use. I have printed both pics and docs and I am fairly happy with the print quality and ease of use. I would recommend this product. The price was pretty awesome also.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to Use; Efficient; Quality Construction; Reliable; Easy To Set Up
I do a lot of greeting cards for personal use & love the print quality & speed. It is far superior to the Kodak printer we previously had. I also think the individual color cartridges will be a plus in the long run as we had to replace the entire ink cartridge very frequently with our previous printer even though it showed 50% full. I haven't printed a lot of photos in the past, but printed one as part of the setup process & it was great quality. May start doing photos now!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: I've had the 7510 for about two months and its performance has been flawless in all functions. Setup was easy without any glitches and the machine has yet to disappoint. The photos are professional lab quality, text printing sharp including in fast draft mode, ADF and duplex functions are reliable with no paper jams, eFax works nicely and is free for low volume faxers like me, the wireless features - both Airprint and ePrint - have worked perfectly, and the touch screen is a big improvement over the previous mechanical controls. I got it when HP discounted it to $159 - a tremendous value for all this functionality. And visually, with a mostly flat black surface and very low profile for an ADF printer, it's attractive and unobtrusive. For ordinary volume home office use, I don't see anythin ... g out there that competes. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Efficient; Reliable
Cons: Needs easier instructions; Difficult To Set Up
I had become used to the simple inst. of it's predecesor printer/scanner/copier. They told me this would be easier to use but I didn't find it so. I am still learning. that said, I was amazed by the quality of the color prints I made while experimenting. As with all HP it seems to shake/rattle and roll while getting ready to print.But the prints are good quality. It is just getting it ready to print that takes more time and steps than it's old version. It also files the scans in some interesting places. I had to have some help getting that part set right-I couldn't find where it put my scans! All in all I am glad I got it. the price was really good for the machine and I am sure with ti ... me I will learn all the ins and outs of it's operation. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent features & performance for the cost.
Item.Review:
Pros: HPeprint photo printing & sheet feeder
Cons: Jamming auto duplex
Our family of 5 uses this on our home network for multiple computers. Setup was a one-time, simple software installation with all features then available on all computers. Sheet-feeder for scanning and copying makes this a truly "business" printer. Printing photos directly from any connected computer to the photo paper tray is automatic. Being at my kids school or sports events, taking a cell phone photo, & e-mailing it to hpeprint for immediate printing at home is a dream. I only have 2 problems with it. First, the auto-duplex system is extremely qirky...sometimes working, sometimes jamming. Second, sometimes for no apparent reason, the printer "loses" its wireless connection to the home networ ... k & I have to reacquire the IP address. Overall, for the price...just buy it! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: Very Poor Printer - DO NOT BUY
Item.Review: When I read everyones reviews before I bought this printer the majority of the complaints were towards the fax. I bought this mostly for the wireless capability and the Photo quality. HP has always in at least my opinion been outstanding. I create calendars for family and friends as a Christmas gift. HP printers have always been the best. This printer didn't work from the start. The pictures have lines in them and trust me I have tried everything that was suggested on line to correct this and they did not go away. Yes, I might of just got a lemon, but try convincing this point to HP themselves. I was actually on the phone with Dan in their support center last night for 2 hours trying everything that I already did to correct this. Nothing work. Then I was suppose to get transferred to a sup ... ervisor who hung up on me twice! Trust me do not waste your time or money on this product. I've have spent $69.00 on replacement cartridges, at least 50 plain pieces or paper, 25 photo prints and 3 days of my time. Not to mention the money I spent to finish my product at Staples. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Airprint
Cons: Bad upgrade from other HP Printer
I decided to upgrade from a 1yr old Photosmart B209a so I will compare these 2 products against each other. I bought this 7510 for 2 reasons the document feeder and Airprint. Time to go paperless and print from iPhones. (New Years Resolutions early) The first 7510 I received had to be sent back because the web functions wouldn't connect to HP's servers. After working on this for days (not joking) HP sent my case to escalations and offered to send me a new printer (very good job). The second 7510 had no issues connecting to the ePrint web servers problem fixed 2 weeks after buying the printer (YAH!) Now time for the ease of use issues. The software package included with this printer is lame and very basic compa ... red to the software I have with my B209a. The major issue is scanning. My B209a has a software called HP Solution Center very nice program. It also is able to configure picture scanning options better like scanning multiple pictures in a single scan and making individual files. With the 7510 can't do that or at least I haven't found it yet. When you scan a single picture unless you specify the size it will scan the entire flatbed print area and guess who gets to do the cropping? Wrong YOU DO the software doesn't auto-crop. With the B209a cropping was done automatically. This can be a real killer when you are scanning a lot of old pictures like I need to do. You also can't scan into a folder now and your scans go into a monthly folder automatically. Not even an option for this. Simple things that should be a checkbox option at least. You can scan into a folder but not a monthly folder to sort through and file later. I know it sounds like complaints about little things but these are usability issues and TIME savers. In summary the software or lack of good software are my problems with this. the Airprint feature and the ePrint stuff is awesome. I haven't messed with the efax yet but glad to have it. I guess I will just use my old B209a to scan in all those old fam ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: photo printing
Cons: document printing isn't like a lazer printer but it works for most uses.
We have only had this printer a few months and only used a few times. The photo prints on photo paper are really good. That was our first print and I thought it looked as good as the original. The scanner is good, simple and easy to use, like most scanners. The document printing isn't something you want to show clients but its great for just printing.
They did an excellent job with making this easy to setup and use. Really intuitive and straightforward. I'd buy it again.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use all the features, prints photos very good and it has a great touch screen menu!
Cons: Love it!
I would recommend this unit for home use as well as small office. The print quality and speed is rather nice for the money. I want to remind buyers you get a great machine for under $150 that does it all including a great e-fax no phone line needed. Best printer I have owned in this price range.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: It's easy to set up, use, and at a great price
Cons: bit slow
I really like this printer. It was a good value. Easy to set up and use. And I like that it does Air print

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: The quality and the wireless print.
Cons: Speed and connection with mac
I bought the 7510 it was the one up from this and had too many issues with it, it was bulky, pricey and wouldn't connect to my mac.
Ended up returning it for this, paid about 60$ less for the same thing. The wireless print connected perfectly but I was on the phone with customer service for over an hour because the scanner wouldn't connect.
The start up is slow and sometimes it takes a minute to recognize that a print job has been sent.
Prints great photos with a separate tray for the paper which is nice.
All in all I will be keeping this printer. The price was good for the quality and functions, and it does everything I need as a college student. I do recommend it.

I'm sure it's my fault somewhere in the setting that im having this problem as well. Individual cartridges are a great feature. Scans very well too. Very satisfied with my purchase.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:

I have had nothing but problems with this printer and will return it. I have to shut my computer and printer down before doing anything with this printer. It does not recognize my computer. When I do get to print, it is extremely slow to begin. It seems like it has to think about printing for several minutes before it actually begins to print...if it every begins. I do not like this printer at all and would not recommend it to anyone.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of set-up, multiple features such as auto duplex
This was our first wireless printer. Moderate home use. The salesperson suggested this model because we were looking for a printer that doesn't go through ink rapidly. So far (we have owned it exactly one month), so good - the set up was very easy; the print quality has been excellent, and it has been easy to use.
It is versatile, with auto-feed and auto-duplex printing. We have had a little difficulty with the auto-duplex feature (getting a message that the paper is too short for this function), but we believe that the problem has to do with the printer cabinet door blocking the auto-feed mechanism, not with the printer. I tried printing a sample photo, and the quality was excellent, but don't regularly use our prin ... ter for photo-printing. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Printing photos from the SD / MMC slot are a snap and the pictures turn out fantastic. I also like the ability to print on both sides of the paper. We've had no issues with the printer dropping off the network. Overall I'm extremly happy with this printer.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Item.Review:

Cons: Wish it had a different Fax setup & the shiny, black cover shows dust quickly.
I bought this printer because I got tired of having to reboot my laptop and turn my Dell printer on and off to make it work wirelessly. I never knew when it would or would not work. So reliability was important to me and so far, it's been very good. Ink doesn't seem to be too expensive, also unlike the Dell printer. Almost cost as much to ink replacement as it did to buy this printer. Setup worked easily on all three of our laptops.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Cons: Haven't had any problems so far.
I bought this printer recently to replace an old Epson. This printer is marvelous! Set up was easy, troubleshooting is simple. Does everything I need. Print speed is fast. Prints double-sided pages without having to remove the paper and put it back in. I highly recommend!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
We got this printer to replace our C7180 . First BIG down fall this new printer has E Fax. I would have never got this printer it I knew that I had to pay a mounthy fee just to be able to fax. The outside of the box does NOT tell you that there is a mounthy fee on top of paying for a printer you MUST pay a fee to fax. Big disapointment.. If HP put E Fax in all there Photo printers I would have to buy a diferent brand of printer. I always liked HP printers but making you pay a mounthy payment just to be able to fax is crazy and I would have NO part in it.
On top of it all this new printer 7510 put lines all more any any Photo's that we would print out. it took a little over a week with customer service help to get that fixed. sorry HP but you would really have to WOW me to get me to ... every buy a printer from you again. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: I am enjoying this printer. It has a nice look, it is fast, the print quality is excellent, it is easy to use, and setup was a breeze. I love the eprint function and the apps!! I have had no problems with this printer or understanding how to use it. This is the best printer I have purchased.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Cons: size

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:

Cons: HP should notify when they are updating the servers as e-print doesn't work during the update.
We purchased this printer last night, and we couldn't be happier! I chose this model because of the photo printing feature. The photos come out better than we expected. We can email pictures from our cell phones and tablet to the printer, and it also prints pdf documents via email. It was very easy to set up by following the on-screen instructions. If you like printed instructions, they are available in the software that comes packaged with the printer. The price of the replacement ink seems to be less expensive than with our previous printer. We are very pleased!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: I am so happy with this printer. It was pretty simple to set up and connect wirelessly to the computer. I have never had the fax or eprint features with other printers, so I look forward to using them. Photos are very clear and bright; copies are perfect. Excellent product.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:

Replacing an 10 year old HP Deskjet 930 series, this is my third HP printer (both still work fine). There was no suprise with the ease of setup. It found my Wi Fi on the first attempt. The drivers installed with no issues (disabled firewall and anti virus) on Win 7 and XP systems. I really like the multiple ink cartridges (replace only the color I need) and the duplex feature sealed the deal for me.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: The print quality is wonderful and it is so easy to install and use.
We didn't know how bad our old printer was until we got this printer. The colors are wonderful and it is so easy to use. Now I wonder why we waited so long to buy a new one.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast Print Time; Low Ink Consumption; Durable construction; Easy To Use; Easy To Set Up; Reliable
Cons: None
Out of box and set up in less than 10 minutes. Easy to use, works great with a MAC so I would guess it would work fine on a PC too. HP printer control app from the app store works fantastic on my iphone. Automatically knows whether to use regular paper or photo paper. Quiet, good looks, and it is one less worry. I used Epson before and got all kinds of error messages about their drivers. HP drivers rock solid. Definately a best buy and safe bet for beautiful pictures and clear text.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: During setup I found that the print head was deffective but customer service took care of it and got a new one sent out to me. I do miss the computer based printer program like I had for my photosmart 3210 all in one.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Efax, photo printing, 2 sided printing, QUIET, easy setup
Cons: Slightly bulky
So, i have had this printer for almost 2 months now, and honestly, i could not have been happier. I have probably gone through 5 printers in 6 years or so. I am pretty rough on them.
This has stood up to the test. The features are great, I love 2 sided printing. Also, the photo quality is near pro grade. I have printed many photos out and people cannot tell the difference.
The other feature that has really sold me on this, is definitely the Efax capability. That is a very new feature, and it is great. I can have a free fax line through them, and not need to connect up to a phone line.
The 2 things that I do not like, is the fact that it is bulky. I know, I am picky. The o ... ther thing is that the paper tray is difficult. Trying to load regular paper or photo paper takes a great deal of patience.
Also, the printer is super quiet. I cannot hear in the next room when I am printing. (my old printer you could hear across the house).
I would honestly recommend this to anyone looking at a printer, and also, the HP ink, is by far the best ink I have ever had. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: HP maintaining it's rep with me!
Item.Review:
Pros: Pretty much everything
Cons: Photo print quality is a little off, but still not bad. Have seen better.
When my old HP C5280 printer just up and died on me, I needed a new one. I don't really care about print speed so if you are looking for that don't bother reading on. I got this cause my old printer had everything that this has and I needed to fill the void my old one produced. I like the fact that I can not only print pics and docs wirelessly, but it has apps like Facebook where you can print the pics that are on your profile there. I needed a printer that used two separate trays for pictures and documents cause all of the cheap ones just have one. One thing that I have had a problem understanding is where is the benefit of having more than two ink cartridges. This ha ... s 5. My old one had only 2. This one takes a little more time just to get to print, meaning once you press print about 5 seconds later it might have the paper drawn in to start printing. I like the fact that this one is a little quieter and it plays a tone to let you know when your doc/pic is done printing. I will miss the simplicity of my old printer, but I have a pretty good replacement! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

My wife is a photo buff and she is very happy with the print quality. I would recommend this printer to anyone for home or small business use. Thank-you HP!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: I love the document feeder and I use it a lot. It prints beautiful color photos. I love the separate photo tray eliminating my constantly having to change papers in the paper tray. The scan and fax features are great. It is easy to make prints from my memory cards. The touch screen is a plus. The only feature I wish this printer had is a bypass tray. When I print double sided cards it would be easier to use a bypass slot rather than continually opening the regular paper tray. I recommend this printer to everyone.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: HP's got a Home Run Here!
Item.Review: HP, you've done it again. Our first was a 722C, and at the time, we thought we had the printing world by the tail. I got a portable printer for my wife to use at scrap booking and that one is a polished diamond. Works with or without a power cord or a USB cable. But this one, it does it all. The wireless printing directly from my wife's I-Pad, well she's favorably impressed, and so am I. She wants to get back into printing photos again, and I believe from what we've practiced with, will fill the bill. I wanted a document feeder, a unit that would do two-sided printing and two-sided copying, and this does both with ease. The two sided copying makes use of the document feeder. The fellow at Best Buy said it wouldn't do two-sided copying, but he was wrong. I believe we've barely scratch ... ed the surface with what this will allow us to do in the paper work involved with our involvement with the VFW and VFW Auxiliary. Multiple-Page reports done two-sided are a challenge to keep straight, but with this 7510, the speed is good and the convenience of doing a 10 page two-sided printing is certainly a bunch easier than before. I have used the Scan to get info from a multi-page document to my computer. And that was like watching David Copperfield wiggle through the Great Wall of China on TV. Complete, astounding MAGIC. One moment I had the documents I wanted in the computer, and then the next, it was on the computer screen easy to read, easy to store and retrieve. HP, Thanks for more magic. The wireless was EASY to set up. I'm not an accomplished computer user and the set up usually is an ENTIRE BUCKET-LOAD of FRUSTRATION. I took the precaution of getting the printer cable and all of the paraphernalia I needed for the 'Non-HP Wireless printer' we had. I followed the directions on the disc, and the computer and software did the rest. There were questions I couldn't answer without calling the Internet Provider with the last one, but the improvement in technology made this absolutel ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: I love, love, love my HP 7510 All-in-one
Item.Review: I have had many HP Printers , but this one is by far the best I've had and I've liked all of them. This is my first Photosmart and the pictures are the most vivid I've ever seen. I love the fact I can go completely wireless and it's been so nice to have a fax again. I let my land line go so didn't have a fax anymore, but I set up the efax and have already used it 3 times, each time with success. The touchscreen feature is really nice and very easy to figure out. I also love the way there is a slot for your envelopes so you can print addresses onto your envelopes which I've used and it too works good. I really can't think of one bad thing about this printer. I'm not real computer savvy, but I set this up by myself and it has worked great. For people that like to take and print pictures, I r ... eally recommend this printer to them because the pictures come out so good, very professional looking. However, it is a good all around printer as well. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Fast Print Time; Easy To Set Up; Reliable; Durable construction
Upgrade from my Photosmart plus b209a all in one. Love the features. Many apps to add to touch screen. eFax is great. 20 incoming or outgoing free per month. ePrint is nice when your not home or in another part of the house. Color prints are exceptional. Printing is fast. And best of all, it's wireless. Including wireless set up. No USB cord needed.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
I bought this all in one printer two weeks ago. I have previously owned Epson printers. One Epson just died and the other one was getting so bad with its color rendition that I wanted to throw it out the window. Very frustrating. So I went to Best Buy thinking I would get a Canon to try something new. But the salesperson recommended this HP. So I bought it, asking the sales guy, was he sure I would get accurate color. He said yes.
So I got it home and set it up. I was blown away at how sophisticated the interface system is with this printer. It's touch screen is amazing. Very fun to use. Extremely comprehensive. This printer does everything and does these things really well. It can print wirelessly from my iPhone or iPad. It can print straight from my P ... icasa account. It scans well. It does two sided printing. (Very slick) It makes copies that are identical to the originals
AND, most importantly, the color rendition is fantastic! When I use high quality photo paper (and Im using the Epson brand paper I have stock piled), photo prints look essentially perfect. When printing on plain inkjet paper from Staples, the quality is still very decent (considering its uncoated, unprofiled stock) 100 times better than the infuriating results I was getting with the Epson printers.
For $149, this device is brilliant. I highly recommend it to anyone. Well done HP!
If you need an excellent printer/All In One, look no further. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: I ordered this printer online through HP and the ordering was very easy. The printer arrived in 3 days in perfect condition. Set up was very easy including the wireless setup. The Windows computer set up the printer fast, but the Linux computers set up the printer even faster, almost instantly, just had to make sure I had the correct version of HPLIP installed. The printer works flawlessly. The photos are beautiful!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Durable construction; Easy To Use
Cons: Large Footprint; Slow Print Time
After having 2 Photosmart Premium Fax printers go bad before their time, I decided to go a little less expensive. (It turned out to be a lot less!) I was able to afford the Staples extended warrenty with the savings. This printer does everything the big boys did except faxing. I seldom fax and can use a free service online on the rare occasions that email isn't an option. The sheet feeder and duplexer have worked smoothly these first couple of times they've been utilized. Photos sent from Photoshop Elements printed beautifully from the photo tray in both 4x6 and 5x7 sizes. It does have a big footprint, but this allows for all loaded paper to be fully enclosed and dust free. The soft ... ware is much simpler and doesn't give the experienced user as many options as the HP Solution Center. I already have that software installed, but it doesn't "see" the 7510 although it is used by the HP Officejet 7000 wide-carriage printer that I also have installed. HP, please, update Solution Center to include the Photosmart 7510! expand » « collapse

The Photosmart 310a was a bust. HP customer service was excellent but could never get the bugs out. Because they tried, I thought I would give HP one more chance. This machine meets my needs. So far so good.

We use it alot. We have a home office and use it for business as well as personal use. It was easy to set up and is very easy to use.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: The Photosmart 7510 All-in-one has an excellent design easy to maintain, good looking and does everything. A state of the art machine to keep up with todays needs.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: This printer is much faster than my old printer. It prints pictures in sharp, vivid colors. I really liked how the printer and cord were packaged in reusable bags instead of plastic bags. They aren't the sturdiest bags but I love that the packaging didn't have to be thrown away, plus the bag that came around the printer was big enough that I think a lot of people would reuse it and it would be an additional marketing avenue for HP. I like the efax feature - I set it up from the printer's panel and it went smoothly. I'm not used to a wireless network printer but it's fast even without a cable connection.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Small-ish footprint; The large display--great; Very good color photos; Fast Print Time; Very good printing; Easy To Use; Reliable; Double-sided printing
Cons: Called HP for Mac feature
This is a very good printer. Best of the lot--for double-sided printing and Photosmart quality photos from the same machine. XL cartridges last long and easy to refill. Print and photo papers both stored and sealed inside the machine. I have not used e-print functions--not sure why I would want to print something from afar. Scan and copy functions both quite good. The print quality is superb.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: Very Fast and overall quality is good
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to set up
Cons: does not always catch the right paper
This is a great deal. I do documents and also photos. It doesn't always catch that a "photo" is being printed and utilizes the regular paper, thus wasting ink. If you take the paper out, it will go straight to the photo paper. It also has e print capabilities, which has been huge for me. I can receive a document email. FOrward it to the printer and it will print for me at home. This is especially great late at night or when I am on the road all day for business.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Compact Design; Easy To Use; Fast Print Time
I like this printer very much. I haven't faxed anything yet so I can't comment on that aspect but so far everything about this printer is good and I would recommend it to others.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast Print Time; Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use
Cons: No scanning software; Can't adjust resolution
Prints great photos. Fast printing. There does not appear to be any scanning software included that would allow one to specify resolution, type of file, cropping color manipulation and etc

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Cons: Unreliable; Hard To Use; Hard Setup; Too much ink used
This printer is very quirky and drinks ink. After one week of light printing I was out of ink. It keeps giving the same error message that HP ink cartridges are installed about 100 times in a single day. It is very annoying. I have tried to turn that off but does not work. Also, on one computer that I installed the software on, it says the printer is paused and it is not. Thank goodness I have other printers in the house and this one was not very expensive, because I am very unimpressed. It is a cool idea to be able to print wirelessly and print from your phone, but it is an unreliable printer and I would not recommend. I still have the box, so I might send it back if I do not have to pay shipping for the return or any ri ... diculous restocking fee. My advice, look elsewhere for a wireless printer. I usually never write reviews for products but this one is a lemon and I don't want anyone to have my same experience. Life is too short to be frustrated by your printer and waste time trying to print. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Reliable; Fast Print Time; Durable construction; Easy To Use; Easy To Set Up; Compact Design; Scans quickly
Cons: A bit too noisy
After my last HP printer purchase 3 years ago, I was hesitant about buying another one. But, I got this on sale and it was definitely worth it! Even at full price, I'd say it's worth the money. The overall quality of the printer itself is MUCH better than my previous one. Set up was easy and I love that it scans very quickly. To save ink, I keep it set on Draft mode as my primary print mode; I think the Draft quality is good enough for everyday documents and it's easily changed if I need to print in Normal mode. Photo quality is excellent. I've only had it several weeks so I'm not sure how it is on ink consumption yet (but is there a printer ... out there that doesn't suck up ink like crazy?). My only complaints are that it's a bit noisy and sometimes does this "printer preparation occurring" where it makes all kinds of noises and takes a few minutes before it begins your print job (what this is, I don't know?) Overall - Love it! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Super easy setup. Great print quality. Tons of apps. Wireless. LED Touchscreen.
Cons: None so far
Bought this all-in-one to replace an Epson that died on me. The setup was easy. Pretty much just turn it on and follow instructions on the LED screen. Print quality is awesome. Printed some test photos and the resolution is amazing. This is my first wireless printer and it won't be my last. The printer is a bit larger than I expected but so what.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: pretty much everything
Cons: it's kind of bulky but I'm not complaining.
My previous printer was a nightmare and it was an HP. So when I went shopping for a new one and didn't even consider looking on any HP printers because of that bad experience. But I was so confuse what printer to get even with all the reviews I read from the internet so I ask the store associate for some advice and recommendations and he recommended me two printers which is an HP. So I listened and tried this one. Now, it's been a month and no problems so far. You can directly send documents to the printer and even access your photos in Facebook. On the quality, I was so amazed on the first photo test print using the sample photo paper that comes with it. But when I used a everyday photo paper the ... quality changed a little. On the ink, I haven't changed it yet but the store associate told me this is more efficient on ink compare to the other HP printer he recommended and it also got the bundle package which is way cheaper than the other printer ink cartridges. So overall, I'm very happy with this printer. Prints fast, good quality, efficient ink, nice touch screen and it's worth the price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice printer but beware fax issue
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to set up
Cons: being tied to a pay for use service to send faxes
Bought this printer because salesman said it had all the functions we were looking for. Set up was an absolute joy ... no brainer to set up four computers for printing. Now the rub ... didn't know that this printer cannot be connected to a phone line for sending/receiving faxes. Okay ... it uses the internet .. no problem, right ... NOT !!!! You get 20 free faxes a month and then if you need to send/receive more you have to buy a membership that runs about $14 a month. This stinks and ALL salespeople should make customers aware of this right up front. I am disabled and taking this printer back to exchange and then re-setup everything is just not worth it. VERY BAD to tie a customer to a pay service w ... ithout their knowledge (by the way the term "efax" means squat to most people). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: Finally an HP Printer that works
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact Design; Easy To Use
So far it works. More than what I could say for the last HP printer I purchased at Staples. Funny no one would help me at Staples nor HP when I had all those issues with the last one. It has been a long 2 years. The last straw was when it started showing a USB port notice when there was not one attached. I could not scan anything when that was blinking. I needed to scan medical records so I had to finally give up on the stupid thing. The set up wasn't as easy as professed.I had to call my cable company for the code that was needed for the wireless hook up. Not an easy task if you do not have the necessary information and in some cases know how. Another disappointment, was the fact that NO one from Staples would help me carry it to ... the cash register nor to the car either. They collected my money though. I hope this new printer continues to print when I push the print button. So far so good. I would not recommend printing photos. They come out blurry, in some cases. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: eprint, free faxes, feature rich
Cons: a touch noisy
I bought this for $150 last month to replace a Lexmark that would not work with our mac pro. It is really easy to set up and use so far. It hasn't had a single compatibility issue with the mac either. It prints pretty fast for an ink jet, and the scanning and printing options are pretty robust. The touch screen took no time to get used to and is extremely intuitive. We use it wirelessly and it has lost connectivity to the network only once thus far. It comes with a free subscription to eFax (20 in and 20 outbound per month at no cost) which comes with a new fax number. My favorite feature by far, is that once it's registered, you can set up an email address for the all-in-one. So, you send an e-mail to this email addr ... ess and it automatically prints. You can do this from your phone, a public computer, or anywhere else. I like this because it keeps you from having to remember to print it out once you get home. This way, it's just on the printer when you get there. It has 2 under printer trays - one for photo paper, and one for regular print paper. Nice touch. This has turned out to be a really good purchase. Although, I'm only a month in, and printers can turn south pretty fast. As long as HP keeps the drivers up to date with the mac updates, I don't foresee any other issues. Also, the ink for this printer is relatively inexpensive compared to it's competitors. I would recommend this all-in-one to anyone considering it for home use. Happy hunting. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
