Cons: Didn't come with Photosmart Essentials, like previous models did.
Great printer. Low cost of operation. Touch screen is a great addition and a good size. I liked that a duplexer was included. Works well from all computers and mobile devices.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Price and ease of use
Item.Review:
Pros: Great photo printing, wireless and touch screen feature
I was looking for a wireless printer that did great photos and documents. This printer is it! For the price you can't go wrong. I had a little difficulty getting it set up to accept printing from our android phones, but a call to my cell provider and them contact HP, it was done in a jiffy. Also showed how simply and easy it was to download an app to get it done.
I like the touch screen feature and if you have questions, you can just have the printer 'show' you how to do it.
I love being able to be in another room and print from there or out with my phone and send a picture to the printer from anywhere!

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: -This is the best printer (along with the eCenter All-In-One) HP makes at his time. The photos I have printed have looked better than what I get from Target and Wal-Mart's kiosks. -Setup was easy. It took me longer to get it out of the box and plugged in than to set it up and get my first photo printed. -These ink cartridges for the Photosmart printers are cheaper than they used to be. Checkout the price on the tri-color combo box 564. Compare that to the price of the previous generation Photosmart ink cartridges. -You can give your printer it's own web address. You can actually print from anywhere you have access to email. -Although AirPrint is an Apple app, HP has an Android app that will do the same thing. (It allows you to print from your smartphone). -The only ... thing you have to plug into the printer is the power cord. It's wireless.
Cons: -You have to either load the drivers from a CD or download them. -You have to load paper in it to print anything. -You still have to wait for the printer to print the ink on the paper. As you can see, there really are no Cons to speak of. It does everything it says it does. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

I bought this printer because I wanted an air-printer for my iMac. This printer was very easy to set up and has been working great ever since. It is a good buy for the money.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: Good multi purpose at a great price
Item.Review:

Other reviews suggested that set up was difficult but I got it working wireless right away without any problems on my Netgear router. Prints great photos and documents. I cant speak to ink usage yet as I have only printed about 15 pictures and some coupons.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Please avoid this printer and save yourself some grief. I am a loyal HP customer and have owned HP printers exclusively for many years. This one was purchased to replace an OfficeJet k80Xi that finally died after 12 years. The main feature I was looking for was wireless printing and faxing but the salesman pointed out many other "gotta love" features such as the eFax capability and wireless connectivity to internet applications such as Snapfish and others. The good: footprint, wireless, bluetooth, memory card capable, built in LED monitor. The bad: efax is horrible. You get 20 free faxes/month but it will do no more unless you sign up for their monthly service at $23/month. There are no other options. No direct phone jack to fax to. Must use internet fax and can only use eFax. Sca ... nning: horrible performance and you can only configure from the computer, not from the printer. It defaults to B&W and there is no way to change it on the printer. You must use the s/w on the computer. If your wireless connection goes down, you are sunk. Wireless connection to computer frequently drops, I think they call it a feature if you don't use the printer for a while. Loud and noisy printing. Once going, it IS fast. Takes several minutes to start your initial printing. Cartridges do not have indicators that show which tank needs replacing. You have to remove the paper tray to load single sheets...no workaround.
I expected better quality and features. I would love to dump this printer and get one with a hardwired fax and one that is quieter. I fully regret this particular printer. I will look at other HPs though. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:
Pros: Great machine for the price!
Cons: I haven't seen anything yet!
This is the best printer/copier/scanner I've ever owned. I mostly use it to print documents & they look great! I've printed some photos, too. They come out pretty good. I really like the way it will print on both sides of the paper without having to manually flip it over. It is easy to use & prints quickly.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.ReviewTitle: Good for wireless printing, copies, and scanning
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, easy to setup, wireless printing
Cons: No built in fax capability, no Ethernet connection option, Efax costs a monthly fee
I run a small home office and my previous printer (HP Officejet Pro L7500) was getting a little long in the tooth. I thought this HP Photosmart 7510 might be a worthy successor for the light duty office work that I throw at it. This was true in most cases but not all.
Setup - the HP 7510 was a breeze to setup. Amazingly the only cord I had to plugin was the power cord and everything else connected wirelessly through my wireless home network!
That was very cool and at first seemed like a huge benefit over the wired spaghetti connected to the back of my Officejet Pro L7500. To set it up I had a phone cord, an Ethernet cord, ... a USB cord and the power cord all connected in the back of the unit and stretching around my office. In stark contrast the Photosmart 7510 doesn't even have a jack for telephone or Ethernet cords. In some ways this complete reliance on wireless connections is really neat but in others not so much. Some people (myself included) appreciate the fact that when you can it is always better to have a hard-line Ethernet connection to a router than to rely on your wireless network signal. the general truism - hard-line is always better.
The second problem I had with the wireless only capability of this printer is that it does not allow you to use your land line phone for faxing capabilities. The Photosmart 7510 box says that it is a 4 way multi-function printer (print, scan, copy, fax) however this unit only has the ability to do Efax. For those of you not familiar Efax is a web based program that you have to sign up for and pay monthly fees to use if you want to send and receive faxes. They have tiered rates that vary depending on the number of faxes you send and receive. Using Efax all of your incoming faxes are routed through a server and delivered into your email inbox. Outgoing faxes are sent to actual fax machines. The bottom line is the Photosmart 7510 cannot fax independently if this is what you need then it will probably be a deal breaker for yo ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review:

I bought this printer for both document & photo printing. I was amazed as to how easy it was to set up on my home network. After loading & configuring the software, I was able to print photos and documents from my desktop and laptop in less than 15 min. Photos are very sharp.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: I've owned HP Printers in the past and although a few bad reviews are out there, this 7515 Printer is fabulous. Easily networked it to my Desktop computer (Windows Vista), my laptop (Windows 7) and my kids OLD computer (Windows XP SP3) wirelessly. Functions great with my iPhone 4s and my wife's iPhone 4. Prints and Scans easily from any of the devices I just mentioned. Color prints to photo paper are very nice. Document feeder is quick and works well. Some of the bad review for this product are coming from people who apparently don't know how to read the outside of the box before purchasing (ie eFax complainers - it clearly states that the printer does not support normal fax line). Overall great product and is making my home/personal office projects easy.

Item.Item: HP Photosmart 7510 e-All-in-One C311a Color Ink-jet - Printer / copier / scanner
Item.Review: This model has some nice features like ePrint and eFax. However, it doesn't perform two-sided copying from two-sided originals using the document feeder as my old HP copier did automatically. Instead, with this copier you must place the original on the glass and turn it over manually--not the most efficient use of my time when I have a several page, two-sided original and need many copies. Otherwise, the document feeder works well for single-sided copies or faxes and the paper tray is easy to load.

Item.Review:

This printer looked nice and seemed to have a lot of nice features. However, its network performance was horrible. It lost its network connection over and over.
